results.title: Mystic pizza
results.creator_credit: Donald Petrie, Scott Rosenfelt, Mark Levinson and Samuel Goldwyn Company
results.brief_description: Friends Kat, Daisy and Jojo share their insecurities, dreams and aspirations as they work at Mystic Pizza, a successful pizzeria in small town Mystic. Kat (Annabeth Gish) is sensible and intelligent, holding down 4 part time jobs to finance her way through next year’s astronomy course and about to become involved with a married man. Daisy (Julia Roberts in her first major screen role), Kat’s sister, is promiscuous and sexy, arguing with her mother who wants her to “calm down” and involved with rich kid Charlie in a possible rags to riches romance. Jojo (Lili Taylor) is engaged to fishmonger Bill but is suffering from pre-wedding jitters and her healthy libido is at odds with Bill’s catholic conscience. All three of them want to make something of their lives - perhaps get out of Mystic, and all three of them are determined to remain friends forever. Cast also includes William R Moses, Vincent D’Onofrio, Adam Storke and Conchata Ferrell.

results.title: Mystery, Alaska
results.creator_credit: Jay Roach, Howard Baldwin, David E. Kelley and Buena Vista
results.brief_description: Mystery, Alaska is a small town where all the men in the community are obsessed with ice-hockey. They have their own competitive league which becomes the attention of a national sports magazine, this leads to someone at the National Hockey League coming up with an idea for an amazing publicity stunt. The New York Rangers are on their way to Mystery to play the local boys in an ice-hockey match. The town goes crazy with excitement, although there a few who that don’t see this as a good idea, more like an opportunity to embarrass their close knit community.

results.title: Mystery train
results.creator_credit: Jim Jarmusch, Jim Stark and MTI productions
results.brief_description: Mystery Train is a trilogy of films all centering on a group of strangers who arrive in Memphis, Tennessee, a city dominated by the historical presence of rock ‘n’ roll, and in particular, the memory of Elvis Presley.

constellations_other.name: Remix and resistance (Since I left you)
constellations_other.description: The Avalanches' music videos are part of a long artistic tradition of reappropriation as a means of reframing perception.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Jim Jarmusch, Jim Stark and MTI productions
results.description: Mystery Train is a trilogy of films all centering on a group of strangers who arrive in Memphis, Tennessee, a city dominated by the historical prescence of rock ‘n’ roll and in particular the memory of Elvis Presley. As in all of Jarmush’s films the pleasure is in his ability to create an identification with characters who are far from the glamorous stereotypes of traditional Hollywood cinema. But as becomes clear in the cross-cutting between the various threads of the film, each individual displays both eccentricities and talents which enable them to transcend the limitations of social roles. Youki Kudoh and Mastoshi Nagase are excellent as a hip Japanese couple making a pilgrimage to Presley’s grave and the rest of the cast are also outstanding. Excellent cameos from Clash singer Joe Strummer and a very funny wild performance by blues veteran Screamin Jay Hawkins. Narrated by Tom Waits and featuring the music of John Lurie, Roy Orbinson, the Bar Kays and Rufus Thomas.

results.title: Mystery Road
results.brief_description: When there is a mysterious disappearance on an outback cattle station, Detective Jay Swan is assigned to investigate. Working with local cop Emma James, Jay’s investigation uncovers a past injustice that threatens the fabric of the whole community.

constellations_other.name: Native Tongue
constellations_other.description: The lead single off her album of the same name, 'Native Tongue' saw artist Mo'Ju explore cultural identity through music, movement and striking visuals.

constellations_other.name: Australians on the world stage
constellations_other.description: George Miller’s Mad Max revolutionised movies when it tore through cinemas in 1979. Max Rockatansky’s journey dispensing justice across the wasteland in his V8 Interceptor became a cult classic and catapulted Australian cinema onto the world stage.

results.title: Mystery Road
results.creator_credit: Screen Australia, Mystery Road Films, Vanessa Loh, Ivan Sen, Matthew Putland and David Jowsey
results.brief_description: An indigenous detective returns to the Outback to investigate the murder of a young girl.

constellations_other.name: Rachel Perkins
constellations_other.description: The moving image has helped tell First Peoples stories through documentary, films and TV shows, with acclaimed director, producer and screenwriter Rachel Perkins contributing significantly to these stories.

results.title: Mystery of the Wax Museum
results.brief_description: Years after sculptor Ivan Igor’s partner burns down his wax museum and his “children”, Igor stars a new museum in New York, but his maimed hands confine him to direct lesser artists. People begin disappearing and Igor takes a sinister interested in his assistant’s fiancé.

constellations_other.name: Movies on wax
constellations_other.description: Waxing lyrical about the supernatural and early 21st-century teen stars.

results.description: Sculptor Ivan Igor struggles in vain to prevent his partner from burning his wax museum, and his “children”. Years later, Igor starts a new museum in New York, but his maimed hands confine him to directing lesser artists. People begin disappearing; Igor takes a sinister interest in Charlotte, fiancée of his assistant Ralph, but arouses the suspicions of roommate, wisecracking reporter Florence.
description_for_label: Sculptor Ivan Igor struggles in vain to prevent his partner from burning his wax museum, and his “children”. results.title: Mystery men
results.creator_credit: Kinka Usher, Lloyd Levin, Mike Richardson, Lawrence Gordon, Dark Horse Entertainment, Golar and Universal Pictures
results.brief_description: Based on the comic book series “The Dark Horse”, by Bob Burden, “Mystery men” is a twisted take on popular superhero films. In a futuristic city, crime has been all but erased by a vain superhero, Captain Amazing, who, with sponsors to placate, is in need of a supervillian to foil. Amazing’s alter ego paroles psychopath Casanova Frankenstein, jailed in an insane asylum for many years. When Amazing goes missing, it is up to the mystery men of the title to free him. The initial posse consists of Mr Furious (speciality is throwing tantrums), The Shoveller, and The Blue Raja, an expert at fork and spoon throwing. These three decide to expand their gang and recruit Spleen man (poisonous farts), The Bowler, Invisible Boy and The Sphinx who can shave metal with his mind. “Mystery men”, which had a reasonable budget and contains some impressive special effects, lost big money at the box office when it was released. Despite this the film successfully satirises the genre and is loaded with subversive humour that makes it an interesting comedy. The cast of great comedic talents includes Ben Stiller, Janeane Garafolo, Eddie Izzard, Hank Azaria and Paul Reubens.

results.title: Mystery island
results.brief_description: This adventure story involves a smuggling racket, a mysterious character and a ship wreck on a desert island - all set in the beautiful Northern Queensland reef islands! Two children visit their cousins who live on one of the islands and left to their own devices, the children get caught up in an intriguing series of events.

results.title: Mystery in the kitchen
results.creator_credit: Don Haldane, Guy Glover and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Why does a housewife concerned for her family’s welfare feed them so inadequately that she endangers their very lives? The film is a humorous and satirical attempt to remind the average housewife that it is not enough to be aware of modern food facts; they must also be applied in daily food purchasing and preparation. Cast includes Kay Tremblay Robert Berger, Norman Ettlinger, Mireille Goulet, Frank Heron. Written by Herb Hosie. Photographed by Reginald Morris. Edited by David Mayerovitch Music by Eldon Rathburn. Sound by Michael McKennirey.

results.title: Mystery at Fire Island
results.brief_description: It’s kids versus the criminals when the search for a missing friend uncovers an international plot! While vacationing on Fire Island, two young cousins risk danger to help find an old fisherman who has mysteriously disappeared. As the intrigue unfolds and the amateur sleuths find their way to solving the mystery we challenge you to do the same. Rated: G
